abstract.p: Christopher Cherney letter says withdrawal of managed-care providers from Medicare market (June 3 article) demonstrates that the government is the best provider of health care to the disabled and the elderly; cartoon

block.p: In the 1960's, Medicare was designed to provide medical care as a social good. In the 1980's, Medicare started its transition toward a managed-care model. Now, managed-care providers are pulling out of Medicare in more than half the states (front page, June 3). These companies, usually more concerned with profit than with social good, have discovered that providing good medical care does not translate into big bucks.

In the 1960's, Medicare was designed to provide medical care as a social good. In the 1980's, Medicare started its transition toward a managed-care model. Now, managed-care providers are pulling out of Medicare in more than half the states (front page, June 3). These companies, usually more concerned with profit than with social good, have discovered that providing good medical care does not translate into big bucks.
The failure of managed-care companies to succeed in the Medicare market demonstrates that the government is the best provider of health care to the disabled and the elderly.
